meanings.definition: A signature, especially of a famous person.
meanings.sent1: I asked the celebrity for his autograph after the show.
meanings.sent2: The autograph on the book proved its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The cat 'signed' the adoption papers with a paw print instead of an autograph.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like an autograph on my heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The autograph glowed brightly on the old photograph, a cherished memory.

meanings.definition: To sign one's name on something.
meanings.sent1: Please autograph this baseball for me before you leave.
meanings.sent2: He will autograph copies of his new book at the bookstore tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to autograph the contract with a wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: Her success seemed to autograph every page of her life story.
meanings.sent5: The artist autographed the painting with a flourish, completing his masterpiece.
